page.title: 11OIL EXPLORATION-HATHERDEN
page.content: In May 1985 a seismic survey team were working in the village. They send vibrations into the ground using four huge trucks with large vibrating pads.The vibrations last about 20 seconds and are taken every 10 metres along the survey line.The sound waves sent into the ground are reflected at the boundaries between rock layers and the reflected waves are measured by sensitive microphones , called geophones, laid along the survey route.From the geophones they pass along a cable to a recording truck where they are recorded on a magnetic tape.The tapes are then sent off to be interpreted before any test drilling is done. The early signs were that the survey team felt that the results seemed to show that oil was present in this area but they did not know in what quantity.
